newsitem.title: USA: U.S. rice weekly export sales highlights - USDA.
newsitem.headline: U.S. rice weekly export sales highlights - USDA.

text.p: USDA rice export sales highlights in latest reporting week:
Net sales of 4,900 MT were down 70 percent from the week earlier and 80 percent from the 4-week average.

The primary buyers were Mexico (2,900 MT--all rough), the Netherlands (2,000 MT), South Africa (1,500 MT), and the United Kingdom (1,500 MT). Reductions were reported for Nicaragua (3,900 MT), Honduras (2,300 MT), and the Dominican Republic (1,700 MT). Sales of 23,000 MT of optional origin rough rice for Costa Rica were designated other than the United States.
In addition, 600 MT of rough rice was reported for Guatemala.

Exports of 18,000 MT were 43 percent below the previous week and two-thirds under the 4-week average. The major destinations were Guatemala (6,600 MT), Mexico (4,300 MT), Haiti (2,800 MT), and Canada (1,400 MT).
